summary: This document is an FBI Laboratory evidence check-in record detailing items submitted for forensic examination, including documents purportedly containing the known handwriting of Jeffrey Epstein and electronic images of a greeting card and an envelope addressed to Larry Nassar. It shows the chain of custody and condition of evidence related to the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Documents submitted as bearing his purported known writing; referenced as an inmate with register number 76318-054.

persons.name: Larry Nassar
persons.context: Electronic image of an envelope addressed to him was received as evidence.

events.title: Evidence Submission to FBI Lab
events.description: Evidence was submitted to the FBI Laboratory for forensic examination, including documents for handwriting analysis related to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Initial Evidence Description
events.description: FBI Laboratory personnel initially described and prepared the evidence check-in notes.

events.title: Evidence Notes Update
events.description: The FBI Laboratory evidence check-in notes were updated by personnel.

keyFacts: The FBI Laboratory received documents submitted as bearing the purported known handwriting of Jeffrey Epstein for forensic analysis.
Evidence included an envelope bearing 'EPSTEIN, JEFFREY Register No. 76318-054', linking it to his incarceration.
Electronic images of a greeting card with handwriting and an envelope addressed to Larry Nassar were also received as evidence.
The evidence packaging for some items was noted as having broken seals or being unsealed, indicating prior handling.
The document establishes a chain of custody for forensic evidence related to the Epstein investigation in August 2020.
